sentences.en: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.cn: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

sentences.en: Don't ask George what his excuse is, he can invent any number.
sentences.cn: 别问乔治的理由是什么, 他可以虚构很多借口.

sentences.en: He can always invent a new game to divert the children.
sentences.cn: 他总能想出新的游戏来供孩子们娱乐.

sentences.en: He had to invent himself almost completely.
sentences.cn: 他不得不自我塑造,简直是从头干起.

sentences.en: He is a knowing fellow, and he will invent something to comfort her.
sentences.cn: 他是个老于世故的人, 会想出办法来安慰她的.

sentences.en: I stood still, trying to invent a plausible excuse.
sentences.cn: 我站着不动，试图编个说得过去的借口。

sentences.en: Modern biographers do not invent such stories.
sentences.cn: 现代传记作家不胡编这样的故事.

sentences.en: Or maybe someone will invent an engine that uses water or sunlight.
sentences.cn: 或者可能会有人发明一种用水或阳光的发动机.

sentences.en: Our company insists on self - create, invent products without stopping , build core power.
sentences.cn: 公司坚持自主创新, 不断研发, 打造核心竞争力.

sentences.en: Roy cast his job aside in order to invent a new machine.
sentences.cn: 罗伊为了发明新机器而抛弃工作.

sentences.en: The most admirable are ones who invent their own success.
sentences.cn: 最值得尊敬的是那些“发明”了自己的成功的人.

sentences.en: Then I began to invent graphic stories without dialogue.
sentences.cn: 以后,我又想出画不带对话的图画故事.

sentences.en: They invented a very convincing alibi.
sentences.cn: 他们编造了很有说服力的不在犯罪现场的证据。

sentences.en: To accomplish this result it was only necessary to invent a township.
sentences.cn: 要达到这个目的,所需要的就是创立乡区.

sentences.en: We have to invent a new method for sneaking prisoners out without being noticed by the guards.
sentences.cn: 我们必须想出新的办法使囚犯们偷偷溜出去而不被看守发现.

sentences.en: We must invent an extension of the idea of triangulation.
sentences.cn: 我们必须把三角法这个观念加以引伸.

sentences.en: What festivals of atonement, what sacred games shall we have to invent?
sentences.cn: 我们该发明什么赎罪的庆典, 什么神圣的把戏?

words.tran_cn: 发明的；有发明才能的；独出心裁的
发明；发明物；虚构；发明才能
发明家；[专利] 发明人；创造者

trans.tran_en: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

trans.tran_cn: 发明， 创造； 捏造， 虚构
trans.tran_en: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing
